crop_details_rice.soil: Clay loam to silt loam with good drainage

crop_details_jute.soil: Loamy, clay loam, or silt loam with good drainage
crop_details_jute.irrigation: Regular irrigation, especially during dry spells
crop_details_jute.pesticides: Insecticides and fungicides as needed to control pests and diseases

crop_details_cotton.soil: Sandy loam to clay loam with good drainage
crop_details_cotton.irrigation: Frequent and deep irrigation, especially during flowering and boll development
crop_details_cotton.fertilizer: Nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium fertilizers applied based on soil test recommendations
crop_details_cotton.pesticides: Integrated pest management (IPM) strategies including insecticides, fungicides, and herbicides

crop_details_pigeonpeas.soil: Well-drained, loamy soils with a pH of 6.0 to 7.5
crop_details_pigeonpeas.irrigation: Regular irrigation is required, especially during flowering and pod development
crop_details_pigeonpeas.fertilizer: Apply a balanced fertilizer (e.g., 10-10-10) at planting and during the growing season
crop_details_pigeonpeas.pesticides: Monitor for pests and diseases and apply pesticides as needed

crop_details_wheat.soil: Loamy or sandy loam soil with good drainage
crop_details_wheat.irrigation: 30-40 cm of water throughout the growing season
crop_details_wheat.fertilizer: 120-150 kg of nitrogen, 60 kg of phosphorus, and 40 kg of potassium per hectare
crop_details_wheat.pesticides: Apply as needed based on pest and disease pressure

rotation_coffee_duhai,up.season_1_reason: Pigeon pea is a nitrogen-fixing legume that enriches the soil with organic matter and improves its fertility for the subsequent coffee crop.
rotation_coffee_duhai,up.season_2_reason: Cowpea, another legume, further enhances soil fertility and suppresses weeds, contributing to sustainable coffee production.

rotation_jute_duhai,up.season_1_reason: Moong bean is a nitrogen-fixing legume that enriches the soil with nitrogen, benefiting the subsequent jute crop.
rotation_jute_duhai,up.season_2_reason: Jute is a deep-rooted crop that helps break up compacted soil and improve drainage, further enhancing soil health.

rotation_jute_mirzapur,up.season_1_reason: Nitrogen-fixing legume, improves soil fertility after jute harvest.
rotation_jute_mirzapur,up.season_2_reason: Drought-tolerant, utilizes residual soil nutrients from moong bean.

rotation_jute_mirzaput,up.season_1_reason: Nitrogen-fixing legume, improves soil fertility after jute.
rotation_jute_mirzaput,up.season_2_reason: Drought-tolerant, utilizes residual nutrients from moong bean.

mini_chat_what_is_wheat: Wheat is a cereal grain, a staple food for millions worldwide.  It's known for its versatility, used in bread, pasta, and many other food products.

rotation_cotton_up.season_1_reason: Nitrogen fixing legume, improves soil fertility for subsequent crops.
rotation_cotton_up.season_2_reason: Drought tolerant, utilizes residual soil moisture and nutrients from moong bean.

rotation_jute_pune,mh.season_1_reason: Fixes nitrogen in the soil, benefiting subsequent jute crops.
rotation_jute_pune,mh.season_2_reason: Drought-tolerant and can utilize residual nutrients from cowpea.

grow_guide_maize.description: Maize, a versatile cereal grain, thrives in India's diverse climate and is a staple food and feed source.
grow_guide_maize.irrigation_plan: Regular irrigation is crucial, especially during flowering and grain filling stages. Aim for 2-3 irrigations per week.
grow_guide_maize.pesticide_usage: Key pests include stem borers, earworms, and aphids.  Integrated pest management practices, including crop rotation, biological control, and judicious pesticide use, are recommended.

rotation_pigeonpeas_ghaziabad,up.season_1_reason: Wheat is a suitable crop to follow pigeonpeas due to its ability to utilize residual soil moisture and nutrients, and it helps to break disease and pest cycles
rotation_pigeonpeas_ghaziabad,up.season_2_reason: Mungbean is a legume that fixes nitrogen, replenishing soil fertility after wheat, and its short duration allows it to fit between wheat and the next crop, making it an ideal choice for the second season

rotation_cotton_ghaziabad,_up.season_1_reason: Wheat is a suitable crop for the winter season in Ghaziabad, UP, and it helps to break disease and pest cycles associated with cotton. It also improves soil health by adding organic matter.
rotation_cotton_ghaziabad,_up.season_2_reason: Mung bean is a legume that fixes nitrogen in the soil, which benefits the soil after wheat. It's also a low-water requirement crop, suitable for the summer season in Ghaziabad, and helps to control nematodes that can harm subsequent crops.
